# Creating and Updating Test Data
Make sure you start with an empty environment.

```bash
rm db.sqlite3 
websecmap migrate

# Create a superuser like: admin / websecmap
websecmap createsuperuser --username admin --email blank@example.com
```

Now configure the installation to use enable all features by default:
```bash
websecmap constance set SHOW_ANNOUNCEMENT True
websecmap constance set ANNOUNCEMENT "This is a test announcement"
websecmap constance set PROJECT_NAME "WebSecMap Development"
websecmap constance set PROJECT_TAGLINE "Ich liebe es wenn ein Plan funktioniert"
websecmap constance set PROJECT_COUNTRY 'NL'
websecmap constance set RESPONSIBLE_ORGANIZATION_NAME "Web Security Map"
websecmap constance set RESPONSIBLE_ORGANIZATION_PROMO_TEXT "Fix your basic security please!"
websecmap constance set RESPONSIBLE_ORGANIZATION_WEBSITE "https://websecuritymap.org"
websecmap constance set GITTER_CHAT_ENABLE True
websecmap constance set SHOW_COMPLY_OR_EXPLAIN True
websecmap constance set SHOW_SCAN_SCHEDULE True
```

Configure what will be shown on the map, we will configure NL and DE manually:


Further configure the installation:
```bash
websecmap shell
```

```python
from websecmap.organizations.models import OrganizationType
OrganizationType(**{'name': 'government'}).save() 

from websecmap.map.models import Configuration
Configuration(**{'country': "NL", 'organization_type': OrganizationType.objects.get(name='municipality'), 'is_displayed': True, 'is_the_default_option': True, 'is_scanned': True, 'is_reported': True}).save()
Configuration(**{'country': "NL", 'organization_type': OrganizationType.objects.get(name='government'), 'is_displayed': True, 'is_the_default_option': False, 'is_scanned': True, 'is_reported': True}).save() 
Configuration(**{'country': "BE", 'organization_type': OrganizationType.objects.get(name='government'), 'is_displayed': True, 'is_the_default_option': False, 'is_scanned': True, 'is_reported': True}).save() 

from websecmap.map.models import LandingPage 
LandingPage(**{'map_configuration': Configuration.objects.get(id=1), 'directory': 'test', 'enabled': True}).save() 
```

```bash
websecmap loaddata periodic_tasks_development
```

Now start working with data. For this we've cherrypicked some organizations and set fictious borders that are efficient.
All maps will have a mix of these organizations, to make sure both polygons, multipolygons and points work when mixed.
```bash
websecmap shell
```

```python

        'type': 'government',
        'country': 'BE',

            'geojsontype': 'Point',
            'area': [4.791488699999945,52.9526402]
        }
    },
]
for organization in organizations:
    o = Organization(**{'name': organization['name'], 'type': OrganizationType.objects.get(name=organization['type']), 'country': organization['country']})
    o.save()
    c = Coordinate(**{'organization': o, 'geojsontype': organization['coordinate']['geojsontype'], 'area': organization['coordinate']['area']})
    c.save()
    u = Url(**{'url': organization['url']})
    u.save()
    u.organization.add(o)
```

And now make sure there are scans via onboarding. Note you need to run the worker and broker for this.
Note that running random proxies might be very slow and unreliable.
```bash
websecmap find_scanproxies --amount=100
websecmap check_all_proxies
```

Now run this a few times in the next hours:
```bash
websecmap scan onboard -m async
```
